author: Barry K
title: 10 Cocktails Every Man Should Know How to Make
text:
2 oz rye whiskey Garnish: lemon twist 
Rinse a chilled rocks glass with absinthe. Discard any excess and set aside. In a mixing glass, muddle the sugar cube and both bitters. Add the rye, fill with ice and stir. Strain into the prepared glass. Garnish with lemon twist. 6/10 Lynnette Marrero 6. Lynnette Marrero's El Chapo 
Famed NYC mixologist Lynnette Marrero brings together tequila and vermouth for a cocktail that you will have no problem ordering out loud — It's called El Chapo , after all. You can find this cocktail on the Llama Inn Brooklyn's menu. 1 dash orange bitters 1 oz Dolin Dry vermouth 1 oz Cocchi Americano 1 oz Peruvian Pisco* Garnish: lemon twist 
Add all ingredients into a mixing glass filled with ice. Stir and strain into a cocktail glass, served up. Garnish with a lemon twist. 7/10 Getty Images 7. Vesper 
James Bond's original signature cocktail ? Yes, please. The recipe is simple, but particular. This cocktail first showed up back in 1953 in Ian Fleming's Casino Royale when 007 said to the bartender, "Three measures of Gordon's, one of vodka, half a measure of Kina Lillet. Shake it very well until it's ice-cold, then add a large thin slice of lemon peel. Got it?" 
You're the boss, Mr. Bond. 3 oz Gordon's gin .5 oz Lillet Blanc* Garnish: lemon peel 
Add first three ingredients to mixing glass with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with lemon peel. 
*Kina Lillet no longer exists, but Lillet Blanc is very comparable. 8/10 The Townsend Austin 8. The Townsend's Caught Between 2 Barstools 
The Townsend , located in downtown Austin, is known for a lot more than a spectacular food menu— their bar is stacked with some very impressive mixologists who have put together Texas-worthy cocktail. And since it hails from Texas, you know Caught Between 2 Barstools has a good dose of tequila. 1 oz Tequila Cabeza 1 oz Del Maguey Vida Mezcal 1 oz fresh lime juice .75 oz Jalapeño-infused Green Chartreuse .75 oz Agave Nectar pinch of Kosher salt Garnish: dehydrated lime 
Place all ingredients in a cocktail shaker for a short shake. Pour into a rocks glass over cubed ice, and garnish with a dehydrated lime. 9/10 Getty Images 9. Negroni 
This cocktail is pretty easy to make . All the ingredients are equal parts, so it's simple and to the point, just how we like it. This is a classic Italian cocktail that is commonly drank as an apéritif, or a before-dinner drink that is supposed to stimulate the appetite. Classy. 1 oz. sweet vermouth 1 oz. gin Garnish: orange half-wheel 
Add all ingredients to an old fashioned glass. Fill with ice and stir until cold. Serve as is and garnish with orange half-wheel. 10/10 Bulleit 10. Bulleit's Bulleit Boilermaker 
Any list of manly drinks is going to have Boilermaker on it. Bulleit gave us their recipe for the Bulleit Boilmaker . Pretty simple— a shot of Bulleit Bourbon or Rye and a glass of beer. Either mix the two or chase your beer down with your whiskey. Beer is dealer's choice. 1 oz. Bulleit Bourbon or Bulleit Rye 6 oz. Beer
